--- title: "Directed Acyclic Graphs" --- # Assignment ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_5c867a6b9d5ed5844bc71c1c6068aaa9'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load packages library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr 1.1.4 ✔ readr 2.1.4 #> ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.0 #> ✔ ggplot2 3.4.4 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ tidyr 1.3.0 #> ✔ purrr 1.0.2 #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(dagitty) library(ggdag) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> #> Attaching package: 'ggdag' #> #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #> #> filter ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_44e6a72e0382c1dad9149d6a445e452b'} ```{.r .cell-code} # DAG for ParkingSpots Parkingspots <- dagify( ParkingSpots ~ Location, Sales ~ Location, Sales ~ ParkingSpots, coords = list(x = c(Sales = 3, Location = 2, ParkingSpots = 1), y = c(Sales = 0, Location = 1, ParkingSpots = 0)) ) # Plot DAG ggdag(Parkingspots, use_labels = "name", text = F) + theme_dag() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_82b9bf03a9abebd97ad1386e49533d41'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load the file car_prices <- readRDS("Causal_Data_Science_Data/customer_sat.rds") # Create a Data Frame df=data.frame(car_prices) df ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_2b0e188ac1ba276e750cbf02344cef3f'} ```{.r .cell-code} # 2.1 Include only significant regressors #lm_2_1 is the regresssion of satisfaction on follow_ups lm_2_1 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups , data = df) summary(lm_2_1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = df) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -12.412 -5.257 1.733 4.506 12.588 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 78.8860 4.2717 18.467 1.04e-10 *** #> follow_ups -3.3093 0.6618 -5.001 0.000243 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.658, Adjusted R-squared: 0.6316 #> F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF, p-value: 0.0002427 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_5b6f2b6b68e6241da889001527e0b891'} ```{.r .cell-code} # 2.2 Regress satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription #lm_2_2 is the regresssion of satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription lm_2_2 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription , data = df) summary(lm_2_2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = df) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -4.3222 -2.1972 0.3167 2.2667 3.9944 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 26.7667 6.6804 4.007 0.00206 ** #> follow_ups 2.1944 0.7795 2.815 0.01682 * #> subscriptionPremium 44.7222 5.6213 7.956 6.88e-06 *** #> subscriptionPremium+ 18.0722 2.1659 8.344 4.37e-06 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 2.958 on 11 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.9597, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9487 #> F-statistic: 87.21 on 3 and 11 DF, p-value: 5.956e-08 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_a3e0d3b2835ef95e7ed2e4dc3e6eb245'} ```{.r .cell-code} # 3 Comparing the coefficients # In the first regression with satisfaction on follow_ups are negatively correlated as increase in satisfaction with the product and service will decrease the follow_up calls to the clients. # In the second regression with satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription is highly correlated premium subscription levels than elite subscription levels. ``` ::: ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_60a999e6e3876c9c56ddeae499df9382'} ```{.r .cell-code} # 4 Plot the data # Not conditioning on subscription subscription_not_cond <- ggplot(df, aes(x = satisfaction, y = follow_ups)) + geom_point(alpha = .8) + stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) # Conditioning on subscription subscription_cond <- ggplot(df, aes(x = satisfaction, y = follow_ups, color = subscription)) + geom_point(alpha = .8) + stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) + theme(legend.position = "right") # Plot both plots subscription_not_cond ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} subscription_cond ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-2.png){width=672} ::: :::
